sqlstring package¶

Submodules¶

sqlstring.sql_builder module¶

class sqlstring.sql_builder.InsertBuilder(table_name=None)¶

Bases: sqlstring.sql_builder.StringBuilder

Creates SQL insert query string

column(column_name)¶

Adding one or more column to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import InsertBuilder
>>> builder = InsertBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').column(['city', 'state_code']).get_query_string()
INSERT INTO address (city, state_code) VALUES (:city, :state_code);
Parameters:column_name – list or str
Returns:an object of type SelectBuilder
get_query_string(insert_suffix=None, format_sql=False)¶

Returning a SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import InsertBuilder
>>> builder = InsertBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').column(['city', 'state_code']).get_query_string()
INSERT INTO address (city, state_code) VALUES (:city, :state_code);
Parameters:format_sql – bool, default value False
Returns:SQL query string of type str
into_table(table_name)¶

Adding one or more table to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import InsertBuilder
>>> builder = InsertBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').column(['city', 'state_code']).get_query_string()
INSERT INTO address (city, state_code) VALUES (:city, :state_code);
Parameters:table_name – str
Returns:an object of type SelectBuilder
class sqlstring.sql_builder.SelectBuilder(limit=None, offset=None, distinct=False)¶

Bases: sqlstring.sql_builder.StringBuilder

Creates SQL select query string

column(column_name)¶

Adding one or more column to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').column(['city', 'state_code']).get_query_string()
SELECT city, state_code FROM address;
Parameters:column_name – list or str
Returns:an object of type SelectBuilder
distinct(value=True)¶

Adding a DISTINCT keyword to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').distinct().get_query_string()
SELECT DISTINCT * FROM address;
Parameters:value – bool
Returns:an object of type SelectBuilder
from_table(table_name)¶

Adding one or more table to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').get_query_string()
SELECT * FROM address;
Parameters:table_name – list or str
Returns:an object of type SelectBuilder
get_query_string(format_sql=False)¶

Returning a SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').get_query_string()
SELECT * FROM address;
Parameters:format_sql – bool, default value False
Returns:SQL query string of type str
group_by(column_name)¶

Adding a GROUP BY clause to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').group_by(['state_code', 'city']).get_query_string()
SELECT * FROM address GROUP BY city, state_code;
Parameters:column_name – list or str
Returns:an object of type SelectBuilder
limit(value)¶

Adding a LIMIT clause to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').limit(5).get_query_string()
SELECT * FROM address LIMIT 5;
Parameters:value – int
Returns:an object of type SelectBuilder
offset(value)¶

Adding a OFFSET clause to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').limit(100).offset(200).get_query_string()
SELECT * FROM address LIMIT 100 OFFSET 200;
Parameters:value – int
Returns:an object of type SelectBuilder
order_by(column_name, order='ASC')¶

Adding a ORDER BY clause to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').order_by(['state_code', 'city'], 'DESC').get_query_string()
SELECT * FROM address ORDER BY city DESC, state_code DESC;
Parameters:
  • column_name – list or str
  • order – str, values ‘DESC’, default ‘ASC’
Returns:

an object of type SelectBuilder
where(column_name, op, value, where_type='where')¶

Adding a where clause to SQL query string.

Example: 
>>> from sqlstring.sql_builder import SelectBuilder
>>> builder = SelectBuilder()
>>> builder.from_table('address').where('state_code', '=', " 'CA' ")
>>> builder.where('city', '=', " 'Oakland' ", 'AND')
>>> builder.get_query_string()
SELECT * FROM address WHERE state_code = 'CA' AND city = 'Oakland';
Parameters:
  • column_name – list or str
  • op – str
  • value –
  • where_type – str, values ‘AND’, ‘OR’, default ‘where’
Returns:

an object of type SelectBuilder

sqlstring.utils module¶

General purpose utility library..

Bases: object

GRAVITY = 9.80665¶
class Constants.Mars¶

Bases: object

Mars constants.

GRAVITY = 9¶
sqlstring.utils.circumference(radius)¶

Calculate the circumference of an object.

2*pi*r

>>> from math import *
>>> round(circumference(600000), 3)
3769911.184
sqlstring.utils.orbital_period(planet, planatary_radius, altitude)¶

Calculate the orbital period of an object.

d = v*t

>>> from math import *
>>> round(orbital_period(Constants.Earth, 600000, 70), 3)
1554.43
sqlstring.utils.orbital_speed(planet, planatary_radius, altitude)¶

Calculate the orbital speed of an object.

v = R*sqrt(g/(R+h))

>>> from math import *
>>> round(orbital_speed(Constants.Earth, 600000, 70), 3)
2425.552
